website_summaries.verdict: The Schwinn Thrasher bike helmet may look big and bulky, but it is still very lightweight. Ideal for light commutes and trail riding.
cons: Strap contact on skin can cause scrapes and chafing
Reports of shell separating from foam lining

customer_reviews.title: Recently in a collision
customer_reviews.text: A couple days ago I was in a collision (car turned through the bike lane without looking) while wearing this helmet. The helmet got destroyed in the crash, which is is job. Thankfully, my head did not. This helmet turned what could have been a fatal or much more serious collision into an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, looks good, and will prevent head injury
customer_reviews.text: I'm definitely a road cyclist, so I pulled off the visor and put black reflective tape all along the top and sides. You can't really see the tape unless there is light directly on it, which I think is pretty cool. It fits well with the adjustable wheel thing on the back. Easy to dial in a comfortable fit. I wrecked while wearing this, and smacked my head hard on the pavement. The helmet took the hit and I kept riding. Easily could have had a concussion, serious road rash on my face, and maybe a cracked skull. Instead I just had a little headache. So it did its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Dixson

customer_reviews.title: I cycle a few thousand miles a year and have ...
customer_reviews.text: I cycle a few thousand miles a year and have had this helmet for about a year. Vented fair well for hot summer rides. I found using a rain cover () makes this helmet function in cold temperatures. With the rain cover I don't use a hat and I've done this down to below 18°F (-8°C). The sun visor works to holds a mirror (). I used a zip tie to securely hold the mirror as I had sometimes knocked it off while adjusting it. My only complaint is that the padding in the front is getting crusty from all the sweat.
customer_reviews.author: A. Que

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new helmet and elected to get this one. It’s ok bc the back strap is pretty stiff. When you pick your head up it can rub your neck. The adjustment straps are some one a bit trickier versus other helmets I’ve used. Wanted to update my review: after using the helmet it developed a crack on the back foam protection area. A little disappointed bc I purchased this helmet bc of the ‘schwinn’ brand & reputation.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe junk
customer_reviews.text: This item is unsafe junk. The plastic fastener that secures the straps beneath my ear does not hold tension, and instead slides loosely up and down the straps. This changes how tight the helmet is strapped to my head every time it moves around. This is unsafe. Helmet fitting recommendations specify that the straps need to be tightly secured beneath the ears for best fit and safety. I will not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: This helmet arrived damaged because the back strap where the dial is was bent. It would’ve pressed into my skull and been very uncomfortable, so I returned it. I bought this helmet because of the price and good reviews, but now I have to go to my local bike shop to get one of those expensive ones, just to make sure I have a helmet that’s in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: D2J8

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my father who is 71 and started cycling for his health. I was surprised when he asked me about helmets, because he never wore hats and was always the type to be too proud to wear safety gear. I purchase this for him as a gift and he's very happy. Said it's lightweight, allows air to flow to the top of his head so he is never hot, thinks it looks as good as a helmet could, and feels like it'll provide protection. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Nuff

customer_reviews.title: Good Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Light and easy to adjust the head band to get the perfect fit. I like the sun visor extension and it does make a difference keeping the sun out of your eyes. I bought this to protect my noggin in case of a fall. I don't want to put that to the test anytime soon so I am trusting that the helmet will do its job if and when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: BobPT

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Got into biking recently due to covid crap. Had to kill gym membership. So, on to a new hobby - biking. It's good to be outdoors again. The bad side of getting into biking? All the equipment needed. One of them is wearing a helmet. So, on to Amazon to choose a bike helmet. Saw this item and bought it. The helmet is comfortable. Sometimes I forget that I even have it on my noggin while I channel my inner Lance Armstrong (minus the EPO) down the bike path. I can't attest about the safety of this because I haven't eaten the asphalt yet. Once I do get into a crash, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: This is a super nice helmet especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a super nice helmet especially for the price. Very comfy and super lightweight. The strap doesnt interfere with my big beard either. helmet stays in place without having to be super tight on your head. So comfy I forget that im wearing it. One issue is the bugs where i live, horseflies and deerflies are super thick this year and they will fly right into the ventilation holes and bite my bald head while im trying to beat them off. If the vent holes had light screen in them it would be a major improvement, but I ride down dirt roads deep in the woods so its only a problem if you ride in my conditions.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Works okay for small adult heads.
customer_reviews.text: So apparently my head is not very adult in size. ( 7 1/4 hat size) I had to fit it and then cut and melt the draw strings if I didn't I'd be smacked in the eye with the left over or keep hitying myself in the ear while biking down the street. I think I probally should have gotten a youth. If you wear a pony tail or bun when fitting it you should continue to as it can drastically change the fit. The back adjuster starts to give me a headache if I wear the helmet over 45 mins. I haven't had to crash test it so I can't say how well it works. It is pretty breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Kitten Under the Tree

customer_reviews.title: $20 Schwin Steal
customer_reviews.text: Ha! My son and I really got into biking the last couple years and honestly have some expensive bikes. He naturally had to have a Troy Lee Designs helmet, which most of us know is pretty expensive & I opted for the $20 Schwinn. Great fit, great ventilation, great comfort, good padding & decent tightening system. Sure, I could’ve paid more, but they all serve the same function...they sent and crack when you crash & then you buy another. $20 for me & $200 for my son. I like my helmet, even if it’s not the top of the line!
customer_reviews.author: JSMiller

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have only tried it on and not yet ridden with it, but I was impressed with the fit and the visor is great to shade the face. The main helmet is larger than my smaller dome, but the fitting contraption within the helmet + the straps make it work out just fine. It looks nice as well. I was hesitant and thought I needed to spend more, but we are not serious bikers and even if we were, I think this would work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet for the price, but the second one I purchased has some quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I really like this helmet for its price, adjustable fit, and features. I used the first one almost every day for a year and the pads became understandably matted and torn up, requiring the purchase of another helmet (replacement pads were more than half the cost of a new helmet). The second helmet just arrived and has some build quality issues. The adjustable rear strap isn't attached to the helmet evenly, so tightening it down makes the helmet sit slightly crooked on my head. Still, for the price I'm not going to complain too loudly.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Its a really nice helmet overall
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, good price a really nice name brand helmet. It has really nice adjusters to make it fit your head. My only complaint is that the inside foam padding is held in place by very little (quantity of) Velcro and these pads are very loose and could easily fall out. This would make the helmet unusable. It is being used by my son, and he will not be careful that these are always in place, nor should he have to check this regularly. I will probably need to buy more velcro to ensure they are sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Backfeed

customer_reviews.title: The helmet saved me today
customer_reviews.text: This helmet saved me today. I am a pretty active rider and had never falling off the bike until today. I saw a racoon on the parking lot while going down the road and trying to tell my daughter who was behind me, but I squeezed the front brake instead of the rear brake, I was threw off the bike. I landed on my hands first, then my right shoulder and finally I had an impact to my head. Without a doubt, without the helmet, I would definitely need to get into the ER and who know what other issue I would have.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy adjustment, great value!
customer_reviews.text: TLDR: Fits great, priced well, looks good. Long story: After unboxing, I put it on and adjustment was a breeze. Took about 15 seconds and I was ready to ride comfortably. The helmet is very lightweight and doesn’t feel big or bulky when you look side to side. The visor is a pretty slick option, too. I’m very pleased with this helmet and for $20, I’m not feeling any buyers remorse whatsoever. If you’re on the fence or looking for a good quality helmet for a reasonable price, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: Well build quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight, comfortable, good build quality and esthetic. I involved in a small accident with my bicycle and I am glad it was on my head even though I didn't hit my head to anywhere. Straps are well covered under my chin and the adjustment knob behind is well easy to reach to adjust it to be tight enough. Straps are secured inside the helmet, not glued; so, it shows the build quality is well enough. I have them almost 6 months and not and issue so far. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Now that I will be doing more road riding, instead of flat rails to trails. I started wearing my helmet. I will say this helmet is great. It cools my head better than I thought. After an hour it was like almost not there very comfortable. I grew up without helmets so it took me a bit to start wearing
customer_reviews.author: Tom  Hendershot

customer_reviews.title: Bought as replacement, snug fit.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Fits better than expected. My forehead circumference is 22.5". Any helmet is better than no helmet. I bought this to replace a helmet I had. Right before it came I got into a bicycle accident. If I didn't have my old helmet on I would have gotten serious head injuries. Look into face protection like sunglasses. If I didn't have those on I would have scrapped my entire eye off (lense was completely scraped).
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable helmet for commuting
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this helmet for about a year. I have two other helmets that were more expensive and that I don't like as well. I have never tested this in a crash, so I can't evaluate that performance area. It is lightweight, comfortable and well-vented. The foam does cause my forehead to sweat on warm days, but a sweat wicking headband takes care of that and keeps sweat out of my eyes. It is easy to adjust to a custom fit. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Carey-Walden

customer_reviews.title: Safety is essential
customer_reviews.text: Provides safety and security for the most important aspects of your well-being: Head and brain. Just common sense to wear protective gear, while biking around, especially in any city. Brand name, with appropriate certifications, well constructed. decent design. High recommendation evidenced by fact I wear this helmet whenever I'm riding my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Gnemik

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is "meh" to me. Apparently all helmets sold in the USA have to meet the same guidelines, so when shopping for a helmet I thought "why pay for an expensive one if they all do the same thing?" The first helmet I received was delivered cracked. I returned and exchanged it, and the second one did come intact. I have worn the helmet a few times, and it fits well. I like that you can adjust it easily with a twist in the back. However, the helmet does not look as good quality in person as it does online. For that reason, "meh."
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Gilmer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this helmet for my wife as she bikes often. Its light weight and great to travel with. However, the biggest problem is in the comfort in the helment and the ability to tighten and fasten the helmet properly. The straps are low quality and the fastners are difficutlt to use. Often, this results in a helmet that does not firmly sit properly on your head and when you think it does, it does not feel very comfortable while riding. I'd be hesitant to repurchase this item and will try to get one with better material (straps, fastners, clips)
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: The helmet seemed fine at first, I even took a tumble on my scooter once and it held up well. After a few months, one of the plastic pieces attached to the foam came off. Several months later, the other plastic piece came off. This didn't seem important because they're just lightweight pieces, maybe for airflow? THEN one of the little clips on the chin strap broke off. Now I can't adjust the strap tightness easily. This is a real issue. It's been about 11 months since I bought it. I'm getting a new helmet and going to ask for a refund on this.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Good helmet
customer_reviews.text: This is a good helmet at a very reasonable price. Some reviews say their helmet arrived with damage, but mind did not. It was packed in a box which was then packed in a delivery box with some air cushion packaging. The helmet itself seems to be of pretty good quality and I think it would protect my head very well should I ever get into an accident (knock on wood).
customer_reviews.author: dezymondTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Beside the trust in the brand, the helmet is lightweight and has all the possible adjustments which make it perfect to fit on any head size. I used it right away and I’m happy with my purchase. It would be great to have some reflection stickers or led light behind, but for this price I think it’s the best you can get from a reputable brand
customer_reviews.author: Francesco Ponticelli

customer_reviews.title: Easily adjusts for comfort, protects the noggin and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my teenage son who always complains about the fit of his other helmet. This helmet is stylish, totally adjustable with the knob adjustment and my son says it is very comfortable. This means he will wear it instead of "forgetting" it at home. It was inexpensive and protects his head from trauma. I am very pleased altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Blind Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice product for the price point. If you're reading this you know they can be very expensive. I trust that if I take a minor tumble wearing this helmet I should be okay. I like the humbleness of the helmet vs some of the other ones out there that scream for attention. I think it says more about the person wearing the helmet than the helmet itself...
customer_reviews.author: gmredline

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Shell was already delaminating when the helmet arrived. Or maybe I should say "coming unglued," because this looks like something a grade school kid built in an arts and crafts class. I had modest expectations given the price and yet this helmet still fell considerably short of them. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: REV

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn - a name I trust!
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding Schwinn bicycles since I was a kid. Great quality brand name. The helmet seems durable. It is light. Wish it was a little bigger, but does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie F.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: At $20 and the highest rated helmet on Amazon, I thought it was too good to be true. It was. This helmet is garbage. The felt on the inside is already falling apart and I haven’t even taken this thing out of the house yet. If you are purchasing a helmet, that means you care about your safety. So don’t purchase this one.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t fit my large (but not abnormally so) head. With the adjusting band maxed out, uncomfortably pinches my forehead and back of head, leaving a gap below the crown. The fact that it only comes in one size should have been a tip-off that it would be too small for larger heads. I was excited to get a good deal on it, but I can’t use it and will have to sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Locutor

customer_reviews.title: For the price nothing else beats it
customer_reviews.text: More than I can ask for for the price. I see where people say it can break however observing it mechanically if you over tighten the rear that's probably what's causing it to break as you are literally pulling pounds of force through styrofoam. Padding is thin. But that just means it's lighter. Do yourself a favor and rip off the visor. It does nothing and looks cooler without it. Great buckle system for under chin though the plastic will probably eventually break after daily use for a year or two. But for the price I would buy a new one every year
customer_reviews.author: meik

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have neck issues, so weight on my head affects those issues. This helmet is nice and light and does not flare my neck issues. It's comfortable on my head, yet the straps are a bit stiff and just a little bit of rubbing at times. But, it doesn't distract me when I'm engaged and would not let that stop me from buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Foreaker

customer_reviews.title: Super flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit this helmet is very light, yet comes another problem, it’s super flimsy! Basically with it’s just thin layer of plastic covering foams. Does not feel safe wearing this, but you get what you paid for. I would say it’s only good for low speed sports like skate, regular bicycle, not for anything exceeding 20MPH.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son to use while he is riding his scooter but it is very uncomfortable. The straps keep on rubbing against his skin and the material of the strap is very coarse and rough. They should have use a more comfortable material or wrap a protective comfortable material around the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Chris swan

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived with multiple cracks and scratches
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Seller sent me a new helmet immediately and the new one showed up perfect. I have used it multiple times and am very happy with it. It fits nicely and I never have to worry about it moving or flying off. Definitely worth it. Helmet arrived cracked. Very disappointed since I was planning on using it tomorrow
customer_reviews.author: Jess A.

customer_reviews.title: Fits adult female head perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fits fine, no issues. Easy to tailor to my specific head. Enough openings to avoid overheating. Only thing is limited reflecting areas so I did buy and place thin silver reflective tape along the long top lines of the helmet and smaller lines on the back of the helmet.
customer_reviews.author: BusyBee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely perfect for my family! The adjustable size is a must as my son has a very round head. He's only 5 but kids helmets won't fit over his big beautiful noggin. I am so excited we can now feel safe to ride. The helmet is light weight and has lots if vents so you will stay cool , even on summer rides!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Young-Lupinski

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but also feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: I cheaped out and got the low cost helmet. I'm giving it a 3 mostly on lack of great comfort and it looks and feels a little cheap but replaces a Giro of about the exact same caliber. When Covid is over, I'll probally go spend more time in an actual shop to buy something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: BS-Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: no extra pads??? gonna get stinky fast
customer_reviews.text: nice helmet for the price has a sleek look im not a big fan but ive gotten faster and recently started riding clipless w cleats so figured might as well keep my brain safe anything can happen. i wish it came with extra pads and the adjuster in the back is tough on my head personally wish there was more padding
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Not toooo nerdy...cough
customer_reviews.text: I haven't crashed in it, but I really like the feel so far. It's not an annoying feeling as I expected. I haven't worn a helmet for bicycling since I was a kid but I figured I'd get one to set a good example for my kiddo. It's not horribly nerdy looking either..as far as helmets go.
customer_reviews.author: Skeleton Stardust

customer_reviews.title: Good helmet that looks good, with a lot of adjustability.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this helmet. It provides good air flow, and has a wide range of adjustability. I have a medium sized head, both in hats and motorcycle helmets. This helmet gives me the room I need to even wear a thin skull cap under it for colder weather riding. The visor is nice to have, and the padding inside does not irritate my skin at all. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinlow

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, good helmet.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 19 yr old daughter and it is a nice helmet. Fits well and is good quality. She actually fell off her bike and hit her head prior to me getting this. She ended up with a decent amount of stitches and a scar. Just because you think you are to grown to wear a helmet doesn't mean you are.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Stringer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THAT FIT ADJUST CRANK! VERY LIGHT TOO!
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable head holer on these helmets are just fantastic.. i can buy way more expensive helmets and none of them have that little crank ratchet that tightens the helmet to your head for a Perfect fit.. it's your standard bike helmet other than that .. it's very light, the venting is good, and the carbon fiber look makes it pretty nice looking..
customer_reviews.author: Jay Micale "Hawk" Professional Pool Player & Instructor for Daytonajay Billiards LLC, Retired ASE Master Auto Technician

customer_reviews.title: Its an excellent fitting helmet
customer_reviews.text: Its an excellent fitting helmet. The straps are adjustable as well as the plastic portion on the back of the helmet. Makes for a nice snug fit. The color has the appearance of carbon fiber and looks nice even if it isn't truly carbon fiber. Construction is pretty well done also. I wear a 7 3/4 hat and it fits quite comfortably with the proper adjustments. There is an o-ring type rubber band that helps keep the opposing strap in place so it doesn't hit your face when it gets windy or you start getting crazy on the jumps... Overall a good helmet at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Soto

customer_reviews.title: Fits great!!
customer_reviews.text: I got back into riding my bike and got a new helmet. I sure am glad I bought this manufacturer/model. It fits great with lots of ventilation. I have never had that many straps on a helmet and was worried. The straps fit the head perfectly and are super adjustable so you get them just right. I was worried about forward visibility but it's a non-issue, you can see great. If I ever need another helmet I will buy the exact same one again in a heartbeat..
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Tonkin

customer_reviews.title: Great value for my (big-headed) 14 year old son
customer_reviews.text: Our 14 year old son outgrew his S/M size helmet - so we upgraded to a M/L. (Does this mean his large cranium holds the brain of a genius - we can only hope). The helmet fits! Should be the last helmet he needs for several years (or until he crashes, that crazy child.!) And the price - as the little chickies say - cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Light weight , comfortable, will save you’re life
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight when wearing. Comfortable, easy to set up, very good looking , sleek, and will protect you’re head in the unlikely event of a fall. Add a portable light. and or reflecting tape for added visibility. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Provenz

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is not as comfortable as I was expecting based off of the reviews. Parts of the inside dig into the top of my head no matter how I adjust the pads on the inside. It also does not conform very well and looks more like a big turtle sitting one someone’s head instead of conforming to the head itself.
customer_reviews.author: Derick McGill

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this helmet
customer_reviews.text: The helmet was easy to put on and is of excellent quality. It was easy to adjust the straps and fit perfectly. It was also very comfortable. The padding was soft yet firm and durable. I would highly recommend this helmet. At it's price, you can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: RazE

customer_reviews.title: 100% better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, I've never used a bike helmet before and told myself that at my age, I better start! This is so comfortable and in following the instructions, I was able to have it fitting perfectly! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chantal

customer_reviews.title: It should keep my noodle safe if I hit it
customer_reviews.text: Kinda dorky looking, but I don't know of a helmet that's not. Can't beat it for the price. Although it doesn't have the cpsc approval thing, all the reviews on here tell me that my chances of traumatic brain injury occurring are slim if I wear this. So I would buy it again. Much cheaper than others and although I wouldn't call it a luxurious fit, it will do the job for when I go riding.
customer_reviews.author: Love to teach

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck on the market
customer_reviews.text: Solid helmet. Best bang for your buck on the market. Relatively light and fits great. With that said, I do have one issue with this helmet and that is that the padding on the interior is a bit lacking. I know it's a $25 helmet but still. I especially have an issue with the plastic adjustment wheel in the back of the helmet. It's made of a hard plastic and the small, thin felt padding they have on it is not enough to cover the entire plastic part and so the hard plastic presses up against my skull and is a bit uncomfortable. It's easily fixed by attaching additional padding and once that issue is fixed; this helmet is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly and turned into a gift
customer_reviews.text: I intended this helmet for myself... But between the time I ordered and it arrived my brother had been in a one person bike accident and gave himself a concussion, broken ribs. When I saw him on his birthday I gave him this helmet and it fut great-- he's happy and I hope safe again.
customer_reviews.author: Yashica Palshikar

customer_reviews.title: micro shell ....
customer_reviews.text: Helmet been pretty nice up until about 2 months of occasional usage. The micro shell is lifting off the helmet and becoming unsightly. Cant return it now as it return date has expired....Just great
customer_reviews.author: fish-n-fool

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Seems well constructed and fits well and the dial strap makes it easy to adjust the fit. No accidents on my end (knock on wood), but I've seen a few reviews where this protected some other bikers.
customer_reviews.author: SRP

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Cheap, and Durable Enough
customer_reviews.text: At this price, this is a great helmet. Overall, this helmet features a lot of bang for your buck. It is reasonably comfortable, lightweight, and feels durable. Wish they had more colors/styles to pick from. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Free88Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good helmet, I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: The "carbon fiber" is just a plastic sticker over the frame of the helmet and it doesn't fit perfectly at the edges, so you see it rippling. The ear portions are difficult to adjust and have them stay adjusted without loosening during a ride. All in all, I do like the helmet. In all the important aspects, it is good. It fits on my head very well and has an adjuster knob on the back. It's comfortable to wear and feels like it would protect me in a crash if I needed it to.
customer_reviews.author: P.Norris

customer_reviews.title: We love them - you adjust them to fit your individual ...
customer_reviews.text: As older adults, we are again starting to ride our bikes. We have never used helmets in the past, but realize that it is truly unsafe to do so. We ordered these due to the previous reviews on Amazon. We love them - you adjust them to fit your individual size head (my husband's head is larger than mine) - they are lightweight, but fit snug and secure. Would recommend these if you are looking for a good, lightweight helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Debbiea

customer_reviews.title: This works for me
customer_reviews.text: I cycle a lot - mostly on the KATY and MKT trails and sometimes on roads - maybe 60-75 miles per week in good weather weeks. This helmet is easy on/off and very comfortable. Good value. Thankfully I have not had to test it.
customer_reviews.author: GoMizzou99

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost or delivery waiting time.
customer_reviews.text: Makes you wonder if it is a knock off Schwinn. I had to press the Schwinn sticker on to ensure it didnt fall off. The side stickers also buckled and had to be pressed on, however over time they will definately peel off. The back foam looked unfinished. Take a look for yourself. Granted it was under $25, however I expected more from such a well known brand. I returned it the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Very well design, comfortable and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike helmet for my husband and it is exactly how I imagined. It is a nice bike helmet, well designed and looks secured. The design is very beautiful and fits perfectly on my husband. Very good value for the price, definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Nina Segura

customer_reviews.title: This helmet is terrible quality. I don't know how anyone is giving ...
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is terrible quality. I don't know how anyone is giving it good reviews; it broke after a few months use. I guess you get what you pay for. I'm buying a higher quality, more expensive helmet now because I value my skull.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not top of the line, but I am required to wear it. If I rode a lot, I'd buy a more expensive one.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I can't even tell it is on my head when I am riding, which is a good thing, I guess. I don't ride much, but a helmet is required, so, since I have a Schwinn bike that has lasted over 20 years I went with the Schwinn helmet!
customer_reviews.author: oibv305

customer_reviews.title: 6 months and I need a new one
customer_reviews.text: After six months it fell apart. Plastic on the strap adjusters broke and the glue starting coming undone on the aesthetics on the outside of the helmet. Pretty sad to see on a schwinn product.
customer_reviews.author: JPL

customer_reviews.title: Light helment but not that confortable
customer_reviews.text: The helmet is fine; attaching it to your head is not that comfortable. Laces are strangely crossed and touch the ears. It can be adjusted but has to do it every time I use it
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: This is very light weight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I have had another one before this. This one is more lighter and comfortable. I think this Helmet is big enough to handle for every men. If you have little bit big head, this should work. Mine is bigger than normal, I think. Also light weight is good for riding. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok!
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a three because the design ontop started to Peel off (glued it back on) over all it’s still a good helmet to wear & it’s not that expensive & the adjustable come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small with multiple pressure points
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely uncomfortable and don't fit well. my head circumference is just under 23" and I feel multiple pressure points on my head riding with this.
customer_reviews.author: G and Y Pain

customer_reviews.title: A very good helmet by Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: This helmet fits the safety aspect one needs, the price point, and the visor. The ratcheting dial in the back allows the user to snug it down or loosen as desired. Several rides in and I like it very much. Don't change a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Fit and Very Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: Received Schwinn Thrasher Bike Helmet today. We bought two and both my wife and I love them. The adjustable tightening knob in the rear is easy to reach, easy to adjust and works great! Tilted head fully forward and it did not slip off without buckling the chin strap. Would never use without the chin strap but it speaks volumes for the snug yet comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Helmet !
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful bike helmet for the price and comfort. I LOVE the dial in the back that allows the helmet to fit as snugly as it's supposed to. Comes with directions to give you the perfect fit. Great ventilation also.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good helmet! Plastic Visor.
customer_reviews.text: Good helmet. I used one for years when I biked everywhere. Never had a serious crash, but it always fit well enough to make me confident that I wouldn't get hurt. It has a plastic visor that breaks pretty easily, but that's the only negative thing I could say about it.
customer_reviews.author: MTFromTheMountain

customer_reviews.title: Great and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is a great helmet. I’m not an avid bike rider just in nicer weather for exercise variety. This helmet is lightweight, easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Great for low-key biking, consider something else if commuting on roads
customer_reviews.text: This is just a plain old bare minimum bike helmet. I feel safe wearing it on trails, but when I'm biking on the side of the road, I start to wish I had gotten a higher quality helmet. I think this is safe for people who bike on trails, on campuses, or in neighborhoods, but if you bike on roads I would recommend looking into higher quality helmets. Brain injuries are easy to avoid if you get the right helmet!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Especially since I've been in a minor bike accident, I think everyone should wear helmet especially if they are doing something other than going uphill..things just pop out of nowhere and you just get unlucky, getting into a bike accident doesn't seem much to do with your biking skill level. It's bulky but it has a dial on the back and fits my head pretty well. Yup I wish it was less bulky but for 20 bucks, not a bad design either. It keeps you safe! All the helmets are safe regardless of their price, so if you are okay with something that is not as compact, just get this one and you'll use it well.
customer_reviews.author: Youjin

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: The helmet features a adjustment wheel to expand or contract as needed, and works amazingly well. It is also light and solidly constructed. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: rhodekill

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for my small head thanks to many points of adjustment. In addition to the adjustable chinstrap, you can adjust the straps that go up the side of your head thanks to a locking mechanism to adjust where the straps fit around your ears. The adjustment dial to secure the helmet around the crown of your head is key. The design is pretty nice for a sub-$30 helmet. I am pleased with the quality at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Ge L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is cheap and fits great on my head. There is an adjustable knob on the back to make sure everything is snug and not going to move around while riding. Haven't tested the crash landing part and hope I don't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Ebert

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this item, prtection, quality, etc. If anything, it has a somewhat old or not modern look cause it is bulky on comparison with others more expensive
customer_reviews.author: jorge

customer_reviews.title: Light, adjustable but no MIPS
customer_reviews.text: Good helmet. Back adjuster so it’ll fit your head. Nothing crazy and not MIPS, but my friend got a concussion with a mips helmet so this is better than no helmet!
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Saved me from a possible concussion
customer_reviews.text: I was riding in Manhattan doing a delivery on bike and didn't see this pothole on the road. I lost control of the bike and fell on my side. The side of the helmet was completely scraped but I came out fine with only a cut on my knee and a bruised rib but had it not been for this helmet, half of my face would have smashed and scraped the concrete. Even after the accident the helmet is still sturdy and I am confident it will protect me.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Very decent helmet for very little money
customer_reviews.text: Haven't crash tested yet but fits comfortably on my big head, stays put, has good ventilation, and a nice eyeshade too! I've owned several other basic helmets of various brands and this is as good or better than any of them.
customer_reviews.author: DaveC

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: I am wearing a cervical collar right now and this helmet saved my life - was biking on the side of the road and was coming over the crest of a hill at 17.2 mph and a utility truck was parked doing maintenance. Slammed right into it and broke the helmet and my bike and was thrown 20 feet back. After a visit to the emergency room, I had no broken bones or neck fractures - I never use to ride with a helmet but decided a month ago I should get one. Thank God! Saved my life! This helmet is great!!!
customer_reviews.author: KGJ

customer_reviews.title: Fit is good and highly adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Fit is good and highly adjustable, so this should work well for anyone who isn't Jimmy Neutron. Only problem I have, which happens frequently enough and annoys the crap out of me, is that the strap adjustments don't lock well and need to frequently be adjusted after sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: safe
customer_reviews.text: I use this helmet for commuting from home to my university. It is safe. Actually, the first time I was headed back home I didn't see a stop sign and crashed on it. Luckily I was wearing the helmet and nothing happened. Completely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable due to adjustment knob.
customer_reviews.text: The adjustment knob in the back presses against the back of my skull. Maybe my head is shaped weird, I cannot say. But that knob makes me not want to wear this helmet at all. It has padding on it too, but it's the top edge that is un-padded and digs into my head. This is regardless of the tightness setting. That being said, it seems like a decent helmet otherwise. Adjusting the fit is simple enough.
customer_reviews.author: Thad

customer_reviews.title: Good value bike helmet with adjustable design
customer_reviews.text: This is a great commuter bike helmet as it is cheap and well built. It's not the lightest helmet but given its price you can't complain too much. The fit is great because it has an adjustable knob. Overall a great value and good helmet for commuting!
customer_reviews.author: Hoppaguy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and excellent fit. What more do you need?
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. My head is close to the 24" maximum of the helmet, so I only had to rotate the dial one click to snug up the fit, but it is a very comfortable helmet. My daughter asked where were the black marks on my forehead. I had to inform her that the old helmet was way too old and new helmets do not leave marks.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this helmet
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet. Better looking that the helmets that cos twice as much at Dicks.. I am very pleased. Lightweight and strong. Good looking 👍
customer_reviews.author: Customer Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Thrasher fits avg male head fine
customer_reviews.text: Another reviewer stated that they received the “commuter” helmet instead of the “thrasher” helmet. I received the “thrasher,” as ordered, and it fits my head fine (and could adjust larger). I believe I have a 7 1/4 hat size, or maybe 7 1/2. The helmet seems lightweight, and fees good on my head. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few of these for my whole family - they're easy to adjust, which is really important for getting my kids to be compliant with wearing their helmets properly. It's the right price, too - as kids do, mine lost theirs, so I replaced it with this same one. Will buy again in the future, as needed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Great Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet! My husband uses it for biking and unicycling. It fits securely and hopefully will protect him when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Love this helmet
customer_reviews.text: This helmet feels great on my head. It's not heavy like other helmets and looks sporty. Because of it's design, it allows air to cool my head as I ride. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I coach a cycling team and am looking for new helmets for our team, so i got a few to test them out. This one fits great and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence E. Doherty Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to adjust size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for both my husband & myself. We've both been pleased with ease of use & durability. It has not (thankfully) been put to the ultimate test in a crash, but based on other reviewers who have, I feel comfortable it would do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second helmet of this kind I own. Very comfy and enable me to install a little mirror on its visor. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: S. G.

customer_reviews.title: Good Skid Lid
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to crash on my bike so the durability hasn't been tested. I do, however, feel that the conscious effort of putting on a helmet makes me a safer bike rider. Perhaps the helmet is imbued with some kind of cyclist magic that ups your confidence and prevents major collisions. Who can say? Also, I don't think I look like a total spaz in this relatively handsome helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

product_meta.title: Schwinn Thrasher Bike Helmet, Lightweight Microshell Design, Sizes for Adults, Youth and Children
product_meta.description: Founded in 1895, Schwinn is an American icon, building some of the best-known and best-loved bicycles of all time. From its very beginning in Chicago, Illinois, the Schwinn mission has been to develop bicycles that allow people to experience the confidence and freedom that comes from riding a bike. Ride confidently and safely with the Schwinn Thrasher Microshell Bicycle Helmet. The dual-fit, 360-degree adjustable system allows for on-the-fly adjustments. Twenty-one flow vents help you keep cool, while a snap-on visor offers protection from the elements. Tapeless technology increases durability and adds unique styling. Heat-sealed pads are integrated for comfort and durability, with side strap-adjusters to assist with a proper fit. This helmet offers full-shell coverage for ultimate protection.
feature_bullets: This schwinn thrasher lightweight helmet is designed for adults; suggested age range: 14 years old and up; suggested head circumference: 22.88 to 24.5 inches
Schwinn 360° comfort pairs a dial adjustable fit system with full range padding for the perfect customized, comfortable fit
Lightweight, three piece microshell enhances durability without weighing you down
20 top air vents provide crucial ventilation on hot summer rides
Adjustable side straps allow you to fine tune fit and comfort and detachable visor helps reduce glare
Dial fit adjustable system adds ease
21 flow vents to keep you cool
Visor offers increased shade while riding

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
